item.title: Abandoned Yamaha motorcycle in woods Parkfield Recreation Ground, 27th January
item.description:
The white Yamaha XJ6 motorcycle has been dumped in wooded area at Parkfield Recreation Ground. It is in woods at rear of Parkfield Way/Fontwell Drive. Number plate is missing. What 3 Words location in woods is //split.coins.chain

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parkfield Way, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Even with little or light rain road section gets waterlogged, 27th January
item.description:
It is usual, even when it rains light this section of the road get waterlogged. There appears either blocked drain or this needs looked in to as it is going on for long-long time, each time when it rains light. Then the water stays there for days. It impacts people walking, as route then stays waterlogged and cars often goes in to the innner-lane, to shops, goes through the stagnant water which stays for days each time, unless dry weather stays for next few days which then dry the surface eventually.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122, Erith Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover, loud bang sound when car passes by, 27th January
item.description:
Every time a vehicle drives over it, especially busses, it makes a very loud banging noise, especially at night. The noise is constant and is disturbing sleep for nearby residents. The cover appears to move when vehicles pass over it and may also present a potential safety risk. This is over a month now! It’s driving the local residents crazy!!! Don’t make this fixed unless you actually do something about this!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weigall Road, Kidbrooke
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement narrow and dangerous for pedestrians, 27th January
item.description:
This report relates to an ongoing public safety risk, not a planning matter. A fixed structure has been installed on the public highway, reducing the effective clear footway width to below accepted minimum standards. The location is adjacent to a busy carriageway and at a bus stop, where pedestrian footfall and dwell time are higher. This creates a foreseeable risk to pedestrians, including wheelchair users, pushchairs, and those with visual or mobility impairments, who may be forced into the carriageway. Please confirm whether a highways or public safety assessment has been carried out, and if so confirm: - the date of the assessment - the department responsible - whether the structure has been assessed as safe or unsafe in its current form If no such assessment has been undertaken, please confirm when it will be carried out. This report cannot be closed until the council has formally recorded a safety assessment outcome, as the risk is ongoing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Plaistow Lane, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car vandalised on Wrottesley Road, 27th January
item.description:
This car hasn’t moved for the past year and it’s now been vandalised in the last 12 hours. I walk past it everyday and saw the smashed window on my way home at around 8pm 26th January 2026. Car is opposite 78B Wrottesley Road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead

item.title: Untaxed vehicle, 27th January
item.description:
The vehicle has been parked right on the corner on double yellow lines. This vehicle was parked in Shieldhall Street last week. It has hand written notes in it saying flat battery and is full of rubbish(blankets/clothing). Today it was in this new location. Still has notes saying flat battery. Some of the rubbish has been taken out and dumped on the pavement alongside it. It is also untaxed.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Abbey Grove, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain puddle covers the underpass entirely, 27th January
item.description:
It has been here for a long while. When rains the water accumulates under the bridge and it is impossible to pass. The water is quite deep and unsafe to walk through. I am using the path with a pram and water can touch the underneath compartment.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Garrick Drive, Thamesmead
